visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a spline chart with the title 'Monthly Average Temperature'. The chart should have styled axes and labels with specific colors and font sizes. The data series should include two series named 'Temperature 2022' and 'Temperature 2023', each with monthly data points. The chart should use custom colors for the series and include additional configurations such as chart margins, background, and legend settings.
visualization_explanation: The Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render a spline chart with a title 'Monthly Average Temperature'. The chart type is set to 'spline', and the background color is light gray (#f9f9f9). The chart has custom margins for better spacing. The x-axis and y-axis labels are styled with a dark gray color (#555) and a font size of 14px. The y-axis title is also styled with a larger font size of 16px. The tooltip is customized with a white background and a light gray border, with a font size of 14px. The legend items are styled with a dark gray color and a font size of 14px. The data series include two sets of monthly temperature data for the years 2022 and 2023, each with a distinct color: 'Temperature 2022' is represented by a tomato color (#FF6347), and 'Temperature 2023' is represented by a steel blue color (#4682B4).
